net.rptools.maptool.model.MacroButtonPro.label: dnd5e_AE2_getConstants
net.rptools.maptool.model.MacroButtonPro.toolTip:
Constants that can be turned into variables for use by the macros

Generates an object with the following structure used to create variables
  {
    "FIELDS_BY_STEP_TYPE": An object with step type keys and list of fields for that step as values
    "NAMES_OF_STEP_TYPES": An object with step type keys and list of step names used by that type
    "DAMAGE_TYPES": A list of all of the supported damage types
    "CHAR_ABILITIES": A list of character abilities
    "STATE_GROUPS: A list of the campaign property state groupings
    "MACRO_COLORS": A list of the colors for macro buttons
    "TARGET_ROLL_TYPE": An object that contains a type named targeted
    "UNROLLABLE_ROLL_TYPE": An object that contains a type named unrollable
    "VERSION_PROPERTY": Name of the action editor version property
    "AE2_CURRENT_VERSION": Currently supported version number of the action editor
    "AE_VERSION_PROPERTY": Name of the attack editor version property
    "AE_CURRENT_VERSION": Currently supported version number of the attack editor
    "WEAPON_TYPES": A set of objects that describe each 'weaponType' supported in REs
    "ACTION_TYPES": A list of all of the supported action types
    "xxx_TYPE": An individual action type from the ACTION_TYPES list.
    "STEP_TYPES": A list of the supported step types
    "xxx_STEP_TYPE": An individual step type from the STEP_TYPES list.
    "STEP_TYPES": A list of the supported step types
    "xxx_STEP_TYPE": An individual step type from the STEP_TYPES list.
    "STEP_FIELDS": A list of the step fields
    "xxx_FIELD": An individual field from the STEP_FIELDS list.
    "TYPED_DESCRIPTOR_KEYS": A list of all of the different type descriptors
    "xxx_TD": An individual typed descriptor key from the TYPED_DESCRIPTOR_KEYS list.
  }

Note that this method generates no output, does not change the scope, and adds a lot of constant variables to the parent scope.
Make sure it is called After the arguments in the parent scope are read
